com.ibm.team.repository.common

public interface IHelper

Common protocol for helper objects.

Method Detail

getHelperType

IHelperType getHelperType()
Returns the type of this helper object.

Returns:
the type; never null

getAdapter

java.lang.Object getAdapter(java.lang.Class clazz)
Returns an object that adapts this item to the given class. The result can be cast to clazz. Depending on the type of item involved, the result may or may not be identical to the receiver.

This method is used to get at the special API for the item when possible.

Pass EObject.class to get reflective access to the EMF underlying object. From the EMF object one can navigate to the EMF class to discover all structural features of this kind of object. Use EObject.eGet/eSet(EStructuralFeature) to access the attributes on the item in a generic manner.

The ground rules for accessing the underlying EMF objects:

  • The name of the EMF class of the object bears the name acknowledged in the item type. That is, this.eClass().getName() matches this.getHelperType().getName()[ + " Handle "]. Similarly, this.eClass().getPackage().getNsURI() matches this.getHelperType().getNamespaceURI().
  • The exact set of structural features inherited from the EMF classes are internal, undocumented, and subject to change. While a client is free to display these structural features for debug purposes, they must not make assumptions about their continued existence or usage.
  • The client must not explicitly modify (eSet) any of the structural features inherited from the EMF classes. These are reserved for use by the implementation of the Client API.
  • The client must not explicitly modify (eSet) meta models or install new ones. The meta models are read-only and reserved for use by the implementation of the Client API.
  • As always, everything in Java packages with "internal" in the name is strictly off limits.

Implementation note: There is no requirement that the nice API provided for an extended item type bear any direct relationship to the underlying EMF objects.

Parameters:
clazz - the desired Java class; must not be null
Returns:
an instance of clazz, or null if this item could not be so adapted
